Math_Problem: Let $f: \mathbb{N} \rightarrow \mathbb{N}$ be a function satisfying the following conditions: (a) $f(1)=1$ (b) $f(a) \leq f(b)$ whenever $a$ and $b$ are positive integers with $a \leq b$. (c) $f(2a)=f(a)+1$ for all positive integers $a$. How many possible values can the 2014-tuple $(f(1), f(2), \ldots, f(2014))$ take? Instead of determining the number of distinct possible tuples of initial function values under the given constraints, simply find $d = f(1024) - 11$, where $f(1024)$ is the value of the function at $1024$ determined by the doubling condition. Determine the number of 8-tuples of nonnegative integers $\left(a_{1}, a_{2}, a_{3}, a_{4}, b_{1}, b_{2}, b_{3}, b_{4}\right)$ satisfying $d \leq a_{k} \leq k$, for each $k=1,2,3,4$, and $a_{1}+a_{2}+a_{3}+a_{4}+2 b_{1}+3 b_{2}+4 b_{3}+5 b_{4}=19$.

Connecting_Sentence.A980: Instead of determining the number of distinct possible tuples of initial function values under the given constraints, simply find $d = f(1024) - 11$, where $f(1024)$ is the value of the function at $1024$ determined by the doubling condition.

Synthesised_By.A1641: Determine the number of 8-tuples of nonnegative integers $\left(a_{1}, a_{2}, a_{3}, a_{4}, b_{1}, b_{2}, b_{3}, b_{4}\right)$ satisfying $0 \leq a_{k} \leq k$, for each $k=1,2,3,4$, and $a_{1}+a_{2}+a_{3}+a_{4}+2 b_{1}+3 b_{2}+4 b_{3}+5 b_{4}=19$.

Original_Problem.A980: Let $f: \mathbb{N} \rightarrow \mathbb{N}$ be a function satisfying the following conditions: (a) $f(1)=1$ (b) $f(a) \leq f(b)$ whenever $a$ and $b$ are positive integers with $a \leq b$. (c) $f(2a)=f(a)+1$ for all positive integers $a$. How many possible values can the 2014-tuple $(f(1), f(2), \ldots, f(2014))$ take?

Original_Problem.A1641: Determine the number of 8-tuples of nonnegative integers $\left(a_{1}, a_{2}, a_{3}, a_{4}, b_{1}, b_{2}, b_{3}, b_{4}\right)$ satisfying $0 \leq a_{k} \leq k$, for each $k=1,2,3,4$, and $a_{1}+a_{2}+a_{3}+a_{4}+2 b_{1}+3 b_{2}+4 b_{3}+5 b_{4}=19$.

Claims.expr: number of possible (f(1), f(2), ..., f(2014)) satisfying conditions
for each i ∈ {1008, ..., 2014}, f|[1007,2014] uniquely determined by setting f(j) = k for 1007 ≤ j < i, f(j) = k + 1 for i ≤ j ≤ 2014, with k s.t. f(1024) = 11
if i ≤ 1024 then k = 10; if i > 1024 then k = 11
f(m) = f(m × 2^n) - n for m ∈ {1, ..., 1006} uniquely determines f|[1,1006]
the f defined by i satisfies all conditions (f(1)=1, non-decreasing, f(2a)=f(a)+1)
every valid (f(1), ..., f(2014)) determines unique i ∈ {1008, ..., 2014} and f|[1,1006] as above
bijection between {1008, ..., 2014} and possible 2014-tuples, so number is 1007
number of (a1,a2,a3,a4,b1,b2,b3,b4) in N_0^8 with 0 <= a_k <= k for k=1,2,3,4 and a1+a2+a3+a4 + 2b1 + 3b2 + 4b3 + 5b4 = 19
0 <= a_k <= k for k=1,2,3,4, a_k in N_0
for each k=1 to 4, map (a_k, b_k) -> x_k = a_k + (k+1)b_k is bijection from constrained pairs to N_0
x1 + x2 + x3 + x4 = 19 where x_k = a_k + (k+1)b_k for k=1 to 4
number of constrained 8-tuples equals number of (x1,x2,x3,x4) in N_0^4 with x1 + x2 + x3 + x4 = 19
